title: Big Ten reveals Michigan football‚Äôs 2026 conference slate
description: The Big Ten released Michigan‚Äôs full 2026 schedule, featuring four straight home games, a midseason bye, and a road finale at Ohio State.
fullText:
Michigan football long knew its opponents and where it would play them in 2026, but what hasn't been known, outside of the first three weeks of the season, is where its Big Ten opponents would fall on the schedule. But as of Tuesday evening, everything is now clear.

The Big Ten revealed the full Big Ten schedule on Tuesday, and now the maize and blue can prepare accordingly. The season is set to open with four straight home games before a road game at Minnesota, one bye week, two more homes games, a trip to Rutgers, another home game, a trip to Oregon, senior day against UCLA, then a road finale at Ohio State.

This article originally appeared on Wolverines Wire: Michigan football‚Äôs full 2026 Big Ten schedule is officially set

title: Duke Miles injury update, Vanderbilt basketball guard out vs Kentucky
description: Duke Miles is out for Vanderbilt basketball vs Kentucky, according to the SEC injury report.
fullText:
Vanderbilt basketball will be without a key piece as it takes on Kentucky for a matchup at Memorial Gymnasium on Jan. 27.

Duke Miles is out for the contest due to an undisclosed issue, according to the SEC's game day injury report.

Miles is No. 15 Vanderbilt's second-leading scorer this weekend. He averages 16.6 points per game and is also second on the team in assists with 77 after transferring from Oklahoma.

The Commodores (17-3, 4-3 SEC) are already thin in the backcourt with Frankie Collins also out. Collins has not played since a December matchup with Memphis.

Miles being out may necessitate more playing time for Jaylon Dean-Vines, Mike James or Chandler Bing, none of whom have played a significant amount of minutes this season. Vanderbilt has struggled to get production out of its bench this season.

For Kentucky, Kam Williams, Jaland Lowe and Jayden Quaintance are out.

Aria Gerson covers Vanderbilt athletics for The Tennessean. Contact her at agerson@gannett.com or on X @aria_gerson.

This article originally appeared on Nashville Tennessean: Duke Miles of Vanderbilt basketball injury update vs Kentucky

title: CJ McCollum sends message to doubters after Hawks-Pacers game
description: Atlanta Hawks guard CJ McCollum was feeling confident after a strong game.
fullText:
CJ McCollum sends message to doubters after Hawks-Pacers game originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Atlanta Hawks made a two-for-one deal when they cut ties with Trae Young this season. CJ McCollum was the headliner of the package.

So far, the McCollum experience hasn‚Äôt gone great in the eyes of many Atlanta fans. With his shot selection frustrating spectators throughout his first few weeks of the team, McCollum has caught some heat on social media as of late.

But after a big night against the Indiana Pacers, he sent a message to his doubters.

via @CJMcCollum: Long season. Don‚Äôt fret. I really do this

McCollum‚Äôs message came right after he went 9-15 from the field and 5-7 from three, scoring 23 points in 28 minutes of action. He nearly locked up a triple-double after dishing out seven assists and coming down with eight rebounds.

The Hawks collected a comfortable victory over Indiana, winning 132-116.

In the seven games leading up to Monday‚Äôs action between the Hawks and the Pacers, McCollum averages 17.3 points per game, while shooting 43 percent from the field. Following his run with the Washington Wizards, McCollum has been struggling from three, going from hitting on 39 percent of his shots to just 26 percent with Atlanta.

Clearly, McCollum isn‚Äôt bothered by it. He was having a strong season with the rebuilding Wizards before the trade and seems to be confident in his ability to get settled and begin having a major impact for the Hawks, who are playoff-hopefuls this year.

After a win over the Pacers, the Hawks are 23-25 on the year. They are in the midst of a three-game winning streak, collecting six wins over their last 10 games. Atlanta has a three-game lead over the Milwaukee Bucks for the tenth seed. They trail the ninth-seeded Bulls by just one game.

The Hawks will be back on the court on Wednesday night for a battle against the Boston Celtics.

title: Ron Rivera interviewed for Arizona Cardinals' head coaching job
description: In a report that came out of left field, the Cardinals interviewed Ron Rivera.
fullText:
Just when you thought the Arizona Cardinals' search for a new head coach couldn't get any more interesting, a bomb dropped Tuesday afternoon. A new name emerged as a candidate the Cardinals brought in, and it is a name out of left field.

According to The Athletic's Dianna Russini, the Cardinals managed to bring is former Carolina Panthers and Washington Commanders head coach Ron Rivera for an in-person interview for the head coaching job without it being known immediately.

Rivera is the general manager of Cal Football in college. He was fired from his job with the Commanders after a 4-13 2023 season.

In his career, he is 102-103-2. He went 76-63-1 with the Panthers and made the playoffs four times, once making it to the Super Bowl. He went 26-40-1 with one postseason appearance with Washington. In his time as a head coach from 2011-2023, he never had consecutive winning seasons. Two of his playoff appearances came with losing records.

Is he a serious candidate to replace Jonathan Gannon? That's what we don't know. We do not know when the interview happened. It might have been early on in the process.

But with a name like that in the ether, it is something to watch, as it appears that the Cardinals are not done with their search.

title: LeBron James, Patrick Mahomes, others react to 'insane' Bill Belichick Hall of Fame snub

Former New England Patriots head coach Bill Belichick will likely be enshrined in the NFL Hall of Fame, but it won't happen in 2026.

In a shocking decision, Belichick did not receive the 80% of votes necessary for enshrinement in his first year on the ballot.

Despite Belichick's eight Super Bowl rings, six as a head coach, he did not reach 40 of the 50 votes required. One of the main reasons, as outlined by Seth Wickersham, was due to the Spygate and Deflategate cheating scandals that took place during Belichick's tenure. According to an anonymous source of Wickersham's, some "believed Belichick should 'wait a year' before induction as penance for Spygate."

The decision not to elect Belichick in his first year of eligibility was not well received. Despite the coach's past scandals and the current unsuccessful transition to college coaching, he is still widely accepted as deserving of the Hall of Fame and should have been elected in his first year.

title: Bill Belichick snubbed by Pro Football Hall of Fame in first year of eligibility, report says
description: Citing four unidentified sources, ESPN reported Tuesday that Belichick didn't receive the necessary 40 votes from the 50-person panel of media members and other Hall of Famers.  ESPN said Belichick received a call from the Hall of Fame last Friday with the news.
fullText:
Six-time Super Bowl champion head coach Bill Belichick didn't get voted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in his first year of eligibility, according to a report from ESPN.

Citing four unidentified sources, ESPN reported Tuesday that Belichick didn't receive the necessary 40 votes from the 50-person panel of media members and other Hall of Famers. ESPN said Belichick received a call from the Hall of Fame last Friday with the news.

The Hall of Fame declined to comment before its class of 2026 is announced at NFL Honors in San Francisco on Feb. 5.

The report of Belichick's snub was met with significant criticism, including from Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes, who posted on social media: ‚ÄúInsane ‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt even understand how this could be possible.‚Äù

Belichick was hired by New England in 2000 and led the franchise to six Super Bowl wins and three other appearances in the title game during an 18-year span from 2001-18. Belichick‚Äôs 333 wins in the regular season and playoffs with New England and Cleveland are the second most to Don Shula‚Äôs 347. He won AP NFL Coach of the Year three times.

Belichick also was one of the game‚Äôs top defensive assistants before taking over in New England, winning two earlier Super Bowls as defensive coordinator for the New York Giants.

Belichick‚Äôs career did have blemishes. He was implicated in a sign-stealing scandal dubbed ‚ÄúSpygate‚Äù in the 2007 season and was fined $500,000 after the team was caught filming defensive signals from the New York Jets during a game.

Belichick‚Äôs tenure in New England ended following the 2023 season. He just finished his first year coaching in college at North Carolina.

Belichick was one of five finalists among coaches, contributors and senior players who last appeared in a game in 2000 or earlier. Patriots owner Robert Kraft was the contributor finalist, with Roger Craig, Ken Anderson and L.C. Greenwood the players.

Between one and three of those finalists will be inducted into the Hall along with between three and five modern-era players from a group of 15 finalists.

AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/NFL

title: USC faces brutal Big Ten football slate in 2026
description: The official unveiling of the football schedule solidifies how grueling the season could be for USC.
fullText:
Entering a particularly consequential season for coach Lincoln Riley at USC, a brutal Big Ten slate won‚Äôt cut the Trojans or their coach any slack in 2026.

That much was clear long before the Big Ten officially released its schedule for next season Tuesday. USC already knew it would face the conference‚Äôs top three teams from a season ago (Indiana, Ohio State and Oregon). But the official unveiling of the slate would further solidify just how grueling the climb could be for USC next season.

Oregon will face Portland State, an FCS team, a week before coming to USC on Sept. 26. Ohio State will have a bye week before its Halloween meeting with USC at the Coliseum, and so will the defending champ, Indiana, which USC will face in Bloomington on Nov. 14.

The Trojans will assuredly have to win at least one of those games to maintain their hopes of making the College Football Playoff in Riley‚Äôs fifth season. The rest of the schedule is hardly a cakewalk too, with trips to Rutgers (Sept. 19), Penn State (Oct. 10) and Wisconsin (Oct. 24).

The nonconference schedule is still being finalized, after talks broke down between USC and Notre Dame over the future of their rivalry series. But with two byes already baked into the Trojans‚Äô schedule, a person familiar with the situation but not authorized to speak publicly told The Times that USC plans to schedule its season opener during Week Zero, with a home game on Aug. 29.

That timing drastically cuts down USC‚Äôs options for finding a fill-in opponent to open the season against at the Coliseum.

In order to play in Week Zero in its home stadium and not internationally or at a neutral site, USC must secure an exemption from the NCAA. That probably limits the Trojans to a team that faces Hawaii in 2026 ‚Äî and thus gets an exemption from the NCAA to play an additional game ‚Äî or means playing a Football Championship Series team, which USC has notably never done.

Starting the season early will allow for USC to add an extra bye week, while most Big Ten schools are working with just one during their 2026 slates. It‚Äôll need that break considering what the latter half of the season holds.

After kicking off in late August, USC opens the season with home games in five of its first six weeks. But after that, the Trojans return home just twice the rest of the season, for matchups against Ohio State on Oct. 31 and Maryland on Nov. 21.

title: Padres‚Äô Jake Cronenworth‚Äôs versatility key to 2026 success
description: Friars still undecided who will be the starting first baseman this season.
fullText:
It is hard to imagine that San Diego Padres second baseman Jake Cronenworth is entering his seventh season with the franchise. A feat that should not be dismissed, as his versatility to play multiple infield positions could be key to the Padres‚Äô success in 2026.

Too often, we value hitting metrics more than fielding stats in determining a player‚Äôs importance to a team‚Äôs success. Cronenworth‚Äôs bottom-of-the-order run production, paired with his outstanding glove work, earned him a full-time starting role with the Padres since arriving in 2020.

He came to San Diego in the Hunter Renfroe trade with the Tampa Bay Rays. The Padres highly valued his versatility, as he could effectively play first base, second base and shortstop.

The intangible is his career fielding percentage (.991), as Cronenworth‚Äôs attention to detail allows him to take a challenge and usually excel in a position change. His defense does not suffer because he has maintained a utility player‚Äôs mentality, despite being the starting second baseman.

Cronenworth is exceptional at fielding balls hit directly at him. Other middle infielders may have more range, but it is not a guarantee that they will field each ball hit in their direction.

Obviously, the front office prefers to keep Cronenworth at second base, but circumstances may force him to play more at first base this season. The Friars are hoping to add another bat before opening Spring Training in Peoria, Ariz. on Feb. 11.

At the plate, Cronenworth‚Äôs value is his ability to move runners along the base paths and drive in those who are in scoring position. His standout season came in 2021, Cronenworth hit .266 (career best) with 21 HR (61 extra-base hits) and 71 RBI. He achieved a career-high 122 OPS+, which earned him his first All-Star Game appearance.

Last season, Cronenworth struggled with consistency at the plate after missing time with fractured ribs. The injury limited him to a .246 batting average with 11 HR and 59 RBI in 135 games. The concern was his lack of power from the left side of the plate, as just 32 of his 103 hits were for extra-base hits.

The Padres hope Cronenworth returns to his former power-hitting, run-producing self, as this would add considerable length to the batting order.

Spring Training should have the same feel for Cronenworth, as he will take fielding reps at first and second base. However, he has no clue where he will start in the regular season. Some time at first base could be in his future, especially with the uncertainty of free agent Luis Arraez possibly returning to the fold.

Thankfully, Cronenworth is the type of player who comes to the ballpark ready to compete. It does not matter where he plays as long as his name is in the lineup.

To get back to the postseason, the Friars must excel at using Cronenworth‚Äôs versatility to their advantage.

title: Why Craig Berbue has huge cut on head coaching Maple Leafs
description: It's a pretty tough outcome for Berube.
fullText:
Why Craig Berbue has huge cut on head coaching Maple Leafs originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Craig Berube has a noticeably different look of late as he coaches the Toronto Maple Leafs.

It has hockey fans talking, wondering what happened.

Berube explained the scoop last week.

MORE:¬†This save from Tristan Jarry makes no sense after he lost his skate blade

Berube himself has been added to the injury list after a mishap in the gym.

title: Sean Payton fired 3 Broncos coaches on Tuesday
description: Broncos head coach Sean Payton fired three members of his coaching staff on Tuesday.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos made a surprise move on Tuesday when they fired offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi. That wasn't the only change to coach Sean Payton's staff.

A few hours after the Lombardi news broke, Denver confirmed that firing and announced the additional departures of wide receivers coach Keary Colbert and cornerbacks coach Addison Lynch. The Broncos now have three open positions to fill this offseason (and that number could grow if they lose any coaches to other clubs).

"I want to thank these coaches for playing an important role in elevating our program over the last three seasons," Payton said in a statement. "I've been fortunate to work with Joe Lombardi for 15 years and am particularly grateful for his many contributions to our success as offensive coordinator.

"We sincerely appreciate Joe, Keary and Addison's hard work and wish them all the best in the future."

Davis Webb could be a strong in-house candidate to replace Lombardi if he does not head a head coach job elsewhere. We will continue to track all of Denver's coaching changes on Broncos Wire.

title: Kentucky vs. Vanderbilt game thread and pregame reading
description: The Wildcats and the Commodores square off in a Music City showdown.
fullText:
The Kentucky Wildcats are set to take on the Vanderbilt Commodores in Nashville for a Tuesday night SEC affair. Tip-off is scheduled for 9:00 PM ET on ESPN. You can stream the game online through WatchESPN.

Despite snowy and icy conditions throughout the region, tonight‚Äôs game will take place in the Music City as both teams look for a key SEC victory. With Kentucky at 5-2 and Vanderbilt at 4-3 in league play, this is a game both squads need in order to stay in the hunt for an SEC regular-season crown.

This is the first of two major road tests for the Cats this week. After tonight‚Äôs clash with the 18th-ranked Commodores, Kentucky will venture into Fayetteville for a Saturday night showdown with the 15th-ranked Arkansas Razorbacks.

While the Wildcats are hoping to make a run at another SEC championship, the real importance is winning enough games over the next five weeks to stay off the NCAA Tournament bubble. They likely need to win at least five more games to stay off the bubble. While that may sound easy, Kentucky has arguably the hardest remaining strength of schedule in college basketball, so nothing can be taken for granted, especially as this team navigates the SEC gauntlet without the likes of Jaland Lowe, Kam Williams, and Jayden Quaintance.

One late injury for tonight: Vanderbilt starting guard Duke Miles has been ruled OUT after initially being listed as questionable to play.

title: Bayern Munich boss Vincent Kompany not giving hints on lineup, sees threat in PSV Eindhoven
description: FC Bayern will get tested vs. PSV Eindhoven.
fullText:
Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany can see that his team is a little tired and banged up, but that does not mean he is planning to rest his most important players ‚Äî especially because Kompany views PSV Eindhoven as bigtime competition.

‚ÄúWinning 6-2 against Napoli and 4-1 against Liverpool ‚Äì those are unique results. You can see that the team believes in itself. They are strong going forward, very quick on the counter-attack. They also have players who score goals. They lost 1-3 against Saint-Gilloise, but we‚Äôre Bayern, we‚Äôre 

‚ÄúI would compare PSV and Bayern, there are many similarities: how we attack, the roles of the strikers, the number 10s, the full-backs, the midfield, the build-up play‚Ä¶ PSV play high pressing and are fully oriented towards the opponents, which makes the team very compact.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in the position of having almost our entire squad available. Only a few still need to integrate after their return. We know PSV‚Äôs qualities. We have confidence in our squad. We believe in those who will start tomorrow.‚Äù

As always, Kompany is keeping his personnel plans close to the vest, but did comment on a few players.

‚ÄúWhen we have so many games, I don‚Äôt decide who plays the day before. I‚Äôll think about it tomorrow after I get up. I have 100% respect for PSV; I know it will be difficult. It‚Äôs not just about (potentially resting) Harry (Kane). The quality of the pressing also depends on energy ‚Äì that was our problem against Augsburg. I have to consider whether it‚Äôs a question of quality or also one of energy ‚Äì I‚Äôll decide that tomorrow. I want to win, there‚Äôs no doubt about that,‚Äù said Kompany. ‚ÄúSacha (Boey) hasn‚Äôt trained that much yet, but he‚Äôs finally recovered from this illness. He showed good signs in training today, he can help us for a few minutes. He won‚Äôt start yet, but it‚Äôs fortunate that he‚Äôs fit again. This comes at the right time for us.

‚ÄúWe all agree that (Jamal Musiala and Alphonso Davies) are two good players. Unfortunately, there‚Äôs no ‚Äòsoft integration‚Äô at this stage of the season; it‚Äôs a hard integration. Playing time is based on performance, that‚Äôs our piece of the puzzle. We‚Äôre close to having a complete squad at the most important time of the season. The important thing is that we have all our best players in February and March. Stani (Josip Stani≈°iƒá) and (Konrad) Laimer will also be back by then.‚Äù

As for Wednesday, it sure seems like Kompany is planning on using his top, available players to ward off a hungry PSV Eindhoven squad.

title: Broncos' recent firing could impact the Ravens' OC search
description: Davis Webb has interviewed for multiple head coaching jobs, but if he stays in Denver, the Broncos could promote him to offensive coordinator.
fullText:
Denver Broncos offensive pass game coordinator and quarterbacks coach Davis Webb is quickly becoming one of the hottest names on the coaching market. Webb has interviewed for head coaching vacancies with the Las Vegas Raiders, Cleveland Browns, and Arizona Cardinals. However, if he doesn't land one of those jobs, a promotion in Denver could be on the table.

As of 5 p.m., NFL Network's Ian Rapoport and Tom Pelissero reported that the Broncos have fired offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi, creating an immediate opening on the staff. With Webb already playing a key role in the offense and earning league-wide interest, he would appear to be a strong internal candidate to step into the offensive coordinator role.

The #Broncos fired OC Joe Lombardi, per me and @TomPelissero.

‚Äî Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 27, 2026

Any final decisions will have to be made once all head coaching positions are filled. It's safe to say that Webb will be in good hands this upcoming season, either as a head coach or the next offensive coordinator for the Broncos. He will then be better suited and one of the favorites to land a head coaching job next season if nothing comes of the Raiders, Browns, or Cardinals.

This article originally appeared on Ravens Wire: The Broncos could promote Davis Webb after Joe Lombardi's firing

title: Marquette Women‚Äôs Basketball Preview: vs DePaul
description: The Golden Eagles return to Milwaukee for an I-94 rivalry game after a pair of extremely shaky road wins.
fullText:
Full faith and credit to Marquette to locking down Butler in the closing moments last time out. Sure, letting a 19-0 second quarter run go to waste as they frittered away a 14 point lead at the start of the fourth quarter down to getting lucky after committing a five second violation and Lee Volker hitting a free throw with 16 seconds left to dodge a problem isn‚Äôt a fun way to go through life.

But Marquette was also going through that particular moment in life without Jada Bediako or Skylar Forbes available. It‚Äôs unclear as to what‚Äôs up with Bediako, although it was the second straight game that she was out and also not on the bench. In Forbes‚Äô case, she didn‚Äôt travel with the team to Indianapolis for what was called ‚Äúpersonal reasons‚Äù on the ESPN+ broadcast. On one hand, it wasn‚Äôt the best possible Marquette roster that head coach Cara Consuegra could have put on the floor for 40 minutes‚Ä¶. on the other hand, did I mention that 19-0 run and the 14 point lead? And that game came just days after Marquette gutted out a road win over St. John‚Äôs in the wake of giving up massive runs to Seton Hall and Georgetown in a pair of losses. So, y‚Äôknow: Yay for getting the W‚Ä¶. but I‚Äôve got questions, and so should you.

We‚Äôll see exactly what‚Äôs up with Marquette and Bediako and Forbes when the availability report comes out on Wednesday afternoon. If they‚Äôre out again, it‚Äôs probably about time for Consuegra to start explaining exactly what‚Äôs going on. If they‚Äôre back in the lineup, then it‚Äôs all systems go and time for the Golden Eagles to stack up a third straight win heading into this weekend‚Äôs rematch with Georgetown.

Date: Wednesday, January 28, 2026
Time: 6:30pm Central
Location: Al McGuire Center, Milwaukee, Wisconsin
Streaming: ESPN+, with Bob Brainerd and Chloe Marotta calling the action
Live Stats: Stat Broadcast
Bluesky Updates: @AnonymousEagle

Marquette is 40-49 all time against DePaul. The Blue Demons have controlled the series 23-22 since the two teams have joined the Big East, but the Golden Eagles have won 10 of the last 11 and each of the last eight in a row after an 85-54 victory in Chicago back in December.

I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything particularly interesting to take away from Marquette‚Äôs first game against DePaul this season in terms of ‚Äúhow do the Golden Eagles approach a second meeting?‚Äù MU was up 7-0 and 18-5 during the first quarter before wrapping up the first 10 minutes up 23-9. The Golden Eagles won each of the remaining quarters by three, nine, and five points on their way to a 31 point victory and no one played more than 27 minutes. I guess the interesting statistical item is that Marquette wasn‚Äôt really knocking anyone‚Äôs socks off with 50.9% shooting overall and 38.9% from behind the three-point line. This wasn‚Äôt a game where Marquette couldn‚Äôt miss, it was more a game where DePaul couldn‚Äôt do anything but miss, so perhaps MU‚Äôs defensive effort against the Blue Demons is the interesting component there.

It will be a slightly different DePaul team this time around against Marquette. Aizhanique Mayo and Shakara McCline missed the first meeting, and they‚Äôve been getting regular minutes for the Blue Demons as the squad has beaten Georgetown and Creighton in their last five games and at least made Seton Hall make sure they stayed down in an 86-77 loss. Not a lot, mind you, just enough to deepen DePaul‚Äôs rotation a little bit and lessen a little bit of the pressure on Katie Novik, the team‚Äôs leader in points, rebounds, and assists, and the only Blue Demon averaging in double digits at 12.1 points per game.

The biggest question for this game is whether or not Marquette comes ready to go. DePaul has the worst defense in the Big East in league action, both in terms of points per possession efficiency and shooting percentages. A locked in Marquette squad should be able to get quality shots and rip the Blue Demons‚Äô defense apart. A not-quite-locked-in Marquette, one that let Butler wander back in from down 15 late in the third quarter and needed to make a free throw to avoid giving BU a shot to tie at the horn? That kind of Marquette is at risk of getting run over like Creighton did in DePaul‚Äôs 76-61 win last time out.

title: UNC basketball projected a Top-5 Seed in USA TODAY Sports bracketology
description: UNC is playing NCAA Tournament-caliber basketball right now. USA TODAY Sports gives the Tar Heels a Top 5 Regional seed in its latest bracketology.
fullText:
Now nearly a full month into 2026, college basketball teams are into the thick of their conference schedules. UNC, which secured a huge road upset of rival Virginia on Saturday, is in the top half of what's shaping up to be a deep ACC.

North Carolina (16-4, 4-3 ACC) rolled through non-conference play with a 12-1 record, securing wins against fellow blue bloods Kansas and Kentucky. The Tar Heels hit an impasse to begin ACC play, losing their first three conference road games, but squeaked by Wake Forest at home and dominated Notre Dame.

UNC has plenty more season ahead, with a third-straight NCAA Tournament appearance increasingly likely. In USA TODAY Sports' January 26 bracketology, released earlier Tuesday, North Carolina is a 5-seed in the East Region.

USAT projects the Tar Heels facing 12-seeded Belmont in Tampa, Fla. Joining UNC and the Bruins are 4-seed, reigning national champion Florida and 2023 Final Four squad Florida Atlantic.

North Carolina and Belmont, the latter a member of the Missouri Valley Conference, previously played in November 2013. If you attended that game at the Dean Dome, you likely still have memories of a painful upset etched in your mind.

After dropping consecutive games at Stanford and Cal on their West Coast swing, the Tar Heels are now winners of two straight. Derek Dixon is a key in the starting lineup, Caleb Wilson remains a superstar and head coach Hubert Davis is now playing his best rotations.

UNC has all the pieces to make a National Championship run. Can North Carolina continue to play at its current pace, rise through the ACC and be college basketball's last team standing in April?

title: New WWE Trademark Filing Hints At Potential Winner Of Upcoming Royal Rumble Match
description: A new trademark filed by WWE is potentially lending credence to a specific outcome of AJ Styles vs. GUNTHER at the 2026 Royal Rumble.
fullText:
Heading into the 2026 WWE Royal Rumble, multiple things are pointing to AJ Styles possibly losing to GUNTHER, then retiring from in-ring competition. The latest backing that outcome is a filing from the United States Patent and Trademark Office.

For weeks, the WWE Universe and WWE commentators have referred to GUNTHER as "The Career Killer," given that he successfully put the careers of John Cena and WWE Hall of Famer Goldberg to rest in 2025. On Monday, filed to trademark "Career Killer" with the USPTO, potentially lending further credence to the scenario of GUNTHER defeating Styles at the Royal Rumble, where "The Phenomenal One" will put his career on the line.

This trademark application specifically aims to cover entertainment services related to professional wrestling, such as digital and broadcast media. As of this writing, the application is awaiting assignment to an examining attorney.

Since GUNTHER bested Cena in his retirement match at the December 13 edition of Saturday Night's Main Event, Styles has demanded that "The Career Killer" show some respect to the legends that came before him in WWE, like Cena. Instead, GUNTHER has repeatedly shrugged off Styles' words and controversially beat him in a singles match on "WWE Raw."

According to fellow WWE star Shinsuke Nakamura, Styles previously disclosed to him that the 2026 Royal Rumble¬†will indeed mark his retirement match. The social media post containing this information has since been deleted, suggesting that Nakamura may have accidently spoiled the result of GUNTHER vs. Styles. As always, though, WWE events are subject to change.

title: Did the Broncos just fire one coach to make sure they don't lose another?
description: The Denver Broncos are looking for a new OC.
fullText:
Did the Broncos just fire one coach to make sure they don't lose another? originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Denver Broncos, two days after losing to the New England Patriots in the AFC Championship Game, have fired offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi. The move comes after the team posted a 14-3 season and nearly went to the Super Bowl.

But if you read between the lines, it seems that the Broncos might have a specific reason for making this decision and that involves another coach on their staff.

Quarterbacks coach Davis Webb is suddenly a hot commodity around the league and is being considered for a head coaching job, despite being just 30 years old and never even being in a coordinator role. He interviewed with the Buffalo Bills, who hired Joe Brady as their new head coach on Tuesday.

However, Webb is being connected to the vacancy with the Las Vegas Raiders, something Sean Payton took a shot at on Tuesday.

However, it seems that the Broncos are recognizing the interest in Webb, a former NFL player who is regarded by many in the league as a guaranteed future head coach, and could be making sure he doesn't go anywhere.

If Webb is a strong candidate for the Raiders job, it seems that the Broncos may have given him a choice between being a coordinator for a team that was one step away from the Super Bowl or taking over a team that hasn't won a playoff game in 23 years.

Make no mistake, with Lombardi out, Webb is the clear frontrunner to become the new offensive coordinator for the Broncos. Should that happen, it brings another interesting question with it?

Would Payton give up his play-calling duties?

That is something many Broncos fans have clamored for since Payton became the head coach, even with the team's success. Perhaps that would be one of Webb's bargaining chips. He could say that he'll turn down the Raiders job, if it's offered, if he is going to be allowed to be the Broncos' new play-caller in 2026.

READ:Broncos must do everything in their power to sign 27-TD free-agent running back

The firing of Lombardi, who has spent a total of 15 seasons working for Payton between the Broncos and New Orleans Saints, sets up some intriguing possibilities.

title: Seattle economy benefiting from Seahawks‚Äô Super Bowl run ‚Äì at least in the short-term
description: (The Center Square) ‚Äì The Seattle Seahawks‚Äô Super Bowl run isn‚Äôt just a win for the team, but also a win for the Seattle economy, particularly for downtown bars, restaurants and hotels near Lumen Field. However, economic principles of fungibility suggest that the overall, long-term economic impact on the city may be exaggerated.
fullText:
(The Center Square) ‚Äì The Seattle Seahawks‚Äô Super Bowl run isn‚Äôt just a win for the team, but also a win for the Seattle economy, particularly for downtown bars, restaurants and hotels near Lumen Field.

However, economic principles of fungibility suggest that the overall, long-term economic impact on the city may be exaggerated.

There is no doubt that the Seahawks' victory over the Los Angeles Rams on Sunday ‚Äì which advanced the team to Super Bowl LX against the New England Patriots on Feb. 8 at Levi‚Äôs Stadium in Santa Clara, Calif. ‚Äì means a genuine, short-term economic boost to Seattle, especially the local hospitality industry.

According to Visit Seattle, hosting National Football League playoff games ‚Äì which the Seahawks did twice, being the top seed in the National Football Conference ‚Äì provides a vital economic stimulus during the typically quiet winter season, with hotel occupancy often soaring more than 50% above typical January figures.

The Center Square reached out to several organizations about the Seahawks‚Äô potential championship run and asked if a team making the Super Bowl brings localized, high-impact spending during the playoffs, noting the difference between a short-term economic boost and the more mixed long-term impact.

‚ÄúUnfortunately, I have absolutely no data to validate whether or not those claims may be true,‚Äù Patrick Connor, Washington state director for the National Federation of Independent Business, told The Center Square.

Joey Thompson, public relations manager at Visit Seattle, had a similar take.

‚ÄúWe won‚Äôt be able to provide any comment just yet, but we may be able to put together an estimated economic impact for hotels after the fact, when more data is available to us,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll make sure to circle back!‚Äù

Downtown Seattle Association President and CEO Jon Scholes said it will be a little while before any specific economic impact can be quantified.

‚ÄúThe platform we use to measure economic impact of events has a lag time of 10-14 days, so we won‚Äôt have the NFC championship metrics for a while,‚Äù he explained.

He did point to a Tuesday morning Puget Sound Business Journal piece that includes a link to a 2025 U.S. Chamber of Commerce report with estimates of spending in the markets of last year‚Äôs Super Bowl participants, the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles.

‚ÄúFor the hometowns of each team, the Chamber estimates the Kansas City metro area could see $123.3 million in spending on the big game, while the Philadelphia metro could see $346.8 million,‚Äù the report states.

Seattle Metropolitan Chamber of Commerce President and CEO Joe Nguyen also referenced last year's Chamber of Commerce report and Tuesday's Puget Sound Business Journal story in touting the Seahawks' success translating into economic success for Seattle.

"Yes, this is true - a Seahawks Super Bowl appearance will likely deliver a real economic boost for Seattle! The U.S. Chamber of Commerce report from 2025 shows the Super Bowl drove hundreds of millions to more than $1 billion in spending nationwide, with increased demand for food, apparel, hospitality, and entertainment reaching cities like Seattle even when they aren‚Äôt hosting (Seattle's estimated benefit in 2025 was $224,636,077)," he said in a statement to The Center Square.

"The Puget Sound Business Journal reports that Seattle retailers and restaurants are already seeing higher sales tied to the Seahawks playoff run, especially in merchandise and game-day traffic. Super Bowl Sunday will likely up that spending across Seattle‚Äôs retail and hospitality sectors, including in the next 12 days leading up to the game.‚Äù

While Seattle is experiencing an economic surge during playoff games, this is most likely a temporary effect that won‚Äôt fundamentally transform the city's overall economy.

While civic boosters and the National Football League often project high economic impact figures, research suggests the true benefit is often a fraction of those, according to researchers from North Caroline State University.

The university‚Äôs report, released earlier this month, argues that the Super Bowl's economic impact on host cities is often exaggerated, with benefits frequently falling short of promises while the NFL captures the majority of revenue. While the event drives immense commercial value, local, long-term economic gains are limited, while public costs for infrastructure and security are high.

While the economic impact of the NFL playoffs in Seattle is often substantial, the fungibility of money suggests the total impact might be lower than advertised. Much of this spending is often diverted from other local entertainment rather than entirely new, outside money entering the economy.

A Super Bowl run is about much more than money, Scholes acknowledged.

‚ÄúA Seahawks march to the Super Bowl just months after the Mariners made a postseason run helps generate a continued sense of optimism and community,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe civic pride extends beyond the playing field and has the potential to drive, on some level, a positive reputational jolt.‚Äù

title: Flyers linked to trade for Maple Leafs goalie

fullText:
Flyers linked to trade for Maple Leafs goalie originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Philadelphia Flyers may soon be looking for another goalie.

The Toronto Maple Leafs could be a good match for a potential trade.

That's the idea suggested in a new article for Daily Faceoff by Anthony Di Marco.

He suggests that the Flyers need to move on from Sam Ersson, who might be "the league's worst goaltender," he writes.

"Speaking with a team source Tuesday morning, there doesn‚Äôt appear to be an imminent plan to replace Ersson in-season," Di Marco writes. "After the season is a different story, as I‚Äôve heard going back 24 months now that the 2026 off-season would give the Flyers clarity on their goaltending picture heading into the future."

MORE:¬†Why Craig Berube has a huge cut on his head

Specifically, Di Marco wonders if the Flyers could go after Toronto's Dennis Hildeby, who doesn't have a great path to time behind Joseph Wall and Anthony Stolarz.

"Woll and Stolarz are signed for two and four seasons beyond this year, respectively, and Hildeby is set to be waiver eligible starting next season with two years left on his current contract," Di Marco writes. "The Leafs have some of their best goaltending depth in a long time considering Artur Akhtyamov has also established himself as a viable prospect in the AHL."

Di Marco adds, "Hildeby is someone I know the Flyers like."

MORE:¬†This save from Tristan Jarry makes no sense after he lost his skate blade

"Is he available? That much is uncertain, but he may be the Leafs‚Äô best trade chip if they want to make an addition ahead of the trade deadline," Hildeby writes. "With no first-round picks in each of the next two drafts and their top prospect, Easton Cowan, already on the roster, they don‚Äôt have much in the way of trade currency. Hildeby, if made available, could be just that.¬†At the same time, the very thing that makes him valuable is a reason to keep him: he‚Äôs signed through 2027-28 at an $841,667 cap hit."

There are a lot of questions to be answered here, and it sounds more like an offseason deal if anything, but it's worth keeping an eye on for the Flyers.

title: Eagles have earned the benefit of the doubt with OC search
description: The Eagles promised they'd cast a wide net, and that's what they have done. No one should be complaining.
fullText:
Look, we get it. The most recent Philadelphia Eagles season was stressful. They lost games they had no business losing, and even when they won, it often seemed as though they were more lucky than deserving. We can still see Jordan Davis blocking a last-second field-goal attempt and running to paydirt to claim victory from what seemed like certain defeat.

Vic Fangio's defense was up to the task when they weren't victims of offensive inefficiency-induced exhaustion. Without Kevin Patullo's unit's support, they sometimes had to endure workdays longer than they expected.

We thought the offense would figure things out. They never did, and eventually all of their flaws caught up with them. Everything imploded with a loss to the San Francisco 49ers in the Wild Card Round, eventually leading to Patullo being shown the door.

We're nearly two weeks removed from the end-of-season press conference featuring Nick Sirianni and Howie Roseman, where both promised a wide-ranging search for the next offensive coordinator. So why the frustration now that they're doing exactly that?

Here's where most can agree: when things are going well, this organization is praised as one of the NFL's best-run. This is a chance to reinforce that reputation, not abandon it. The search isn't over, yet hope has already given way to anxiety for some.

The truth is simple. No one knows whether this OC search will succeed or fail. Not yet. The Eagles know what they're looking for, and history suggests that when they're allowed to conduct a thorough process, they usually get it right.

Everyone loved the Chip Kelly hire. Remember him? That was a rushed decision. Meanwhile, Andy Reid, Doug Pederson, Nick Sirianni, and Shane Steichen were all met with skepticism. Each worked out just fine.

Patience isn't blind faith. It's trusting a process that has earned it. Yikes. Maybe we shouldn't say 'trust the process' in Philadelphia. You get the idea, though. Until proven otherwise, the Eagles deserve that much. There's no sense in doubting this organization now.

This article originally appeared on Eagles Wire: Eagles have earned the benefit of the doubt with OC search

title: Should Chiefs swing big at free agent RB?
description: If the Chiefs are going to swing, swing big.
fullText:
Should Chiefs swing big at free agent RB? originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

There is no denying that the Kansas City Chiefs had a poor run game in 2025, with Isiah Pacheco and Kareem Hunt.

The Chiefs managed just 106.6 yards per game, ranking them 24th in the NFL. That isn't good. The problem was that there wasn't a home-run threat from Pacheco or Hunt. Both are plodders and bruising backs.

That has to change in 2026. The Chiefs need a lightning rod out of the backfield. You could get one in the draft, with Jeremiyah Love, but what about free agency?

The Chiefs tried to get Breece Hall midway through last season, but failed.

So, could they go back to the free agent well? Absolutely, but in my mind, they've got to go big.

Why not attempt to get Seattle Seahawks running back Kenneth Walker, who is the No. 1 free agent back according to PFF?

More:Chiefs fix problematic issue for Patrick Mahomes in latest mock draft

A do-it-all back for the Seahawks, what Walker could do in Kansas City's backfield is a tantalizing thought.

The only problem is with his playoff performances; he's driving up his price, and if he wins the Super Bowl? Yeah, a huge contract is likely forthcoming.

The Chiefs likely won't want to get into a bidding war for Walker's services. Of course, it depends on how much they would want it, if at all.

But Kansas City needs an overhaul at running back, and having Walker behind Patrick Mahomes would be something that gets Chiefs Kingdom excited.

title: Mike McCarthy choked up detailing his love for Pittsburgh
description: McCarthy is the fourth Steelers head coach in 57 years.
fullText:
A new era of Pittsburgh Steelers football began on Tuesday afternoon inside the PNC Champions Club at Acrisure Stadium.¬† 62-year-old Greenfield native and Super Bowl XLV Champion Mike McCarthy is the 17th head coach in Steelers history.

Introduced alongside owner/president Art Rooney II and general manager Omar Khan, McCarthy introduced his plan for the Steelers in his attempt to win his childhood team its seventh Lombardi Trophy. After taking the floor and saying an emphatic ‚ÄúHere We Go‚Äù as he rubbed his hands back and forth, McCarthy couldn‚Äôt even begin his opening statement without getting emotional.

‚ÄúOftentimes, coaches and players put on new team colors, and it takes a minute to feel comfortable in those new colors,‚Äù McCarthy said before pausing and getting emotional again. ‚ÄúBut to be blessed beyond any measure, one day to put on the colors you wore‚Ä¶ when you came home from Mercy Hospital.‚Äù

Awesome seeing how choked up Mike McCarthy got talking about being from Pittsburgh pic.twitter.com/L20jGLxfaE

‚Äî Austin Bechtold (@AustinRBechtold) January 27, 2026

McCarthy inherits a franchise that hasn‚Äôt won a playoff game since 2016 and has been running in place the past three years with 10-7 seasons resulting in lopsided losses in the wild card round.

He understands the weight of being the Steelers‚Äô leader and the responsibility at hand to ensure this fresh start ends

‚ÄúI want to thank Art Rooney II, Omar Khan, Dan Rooney, and the entire Steelers organization for the trust they‚Äôve placed in me to represent one of the most storied franchises in all of sports,‚Äù McCarthy said.

McCarthy replaces Mike Tomlin, who stepped down after a seventh consecutive playoff loss and a historic 19-year run leading the Steelers

‚ÄúI understand and embrace the responsibility, privilege, and the weight that comes with this stewardship,‚Äù McCarthy said.

The amount of pride in being from Pittsburgh is evident from your neighbor or community, to Pat McAfee and others on national TV, to Joe Manganiello and Billy Gardell in Hollywood. Pittsburgh people love where they‚Äôre from. McCarthy is one and the same as the rest of Pittsburgh natives.

‚ÄúThis city, this franchise, this fan base means the world to me. Because Pittsburgh‚Äôs my world,‚Äù McCarthy said, tapping his chest. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just awesome to be back here.‚Äù

McCarthy thanked friends Tomlin and Bill Cowher, whom he said represented the team with class, and he is honored to follow in their footsteps.

He thanked his family and said they can now proudly wear their Steelers swag and not hide the love they have for the team. But now the work begins to ensure the Steelers return to prominence.

‚ÄúMy heart is full, my focus is singular, and it‚Äôs time to bring another championship back to this great city,‚Äù McCarthy said. ‚ÄúWith that, I just want to make sure that when we do get that seventh trophy in the case, we‚Äôll start that victory parade at 1137 Greenfield Ave.‚Äù

title: San Diegan Xander Schauffele makes a case for Torrey Pines having prominent spot on future PGA Tour schedule
description: Xander Schauffele thinks that his hometown of San Diego and the Torrey Pines golf courses likely will remain in a prominent place on the PGA Tour's schedule in the future
fullText:
SAN DIEGO ‚Äî Xander Schauffele was born in a hospital in La Jolla that is 2¬Ω miles from the clubhouse at the Torrey Pines golf municipal courses. He played high school and college golf atop the cliffs, built a dream home eight miles away and has competed in the Farmers Insurance Open in every season he‚Äôs been a pro, save last year when he was dealing with an injury.

So, yes, he‚Äôll be the first to admit he‚Äôs biased when it comes to seeing Torrey Pines and San Diego remain on the PGA Tour schedule in perpetuity‚Äîat a time when there is so much speculation about which tournaments will remain and which will disappear when the Future Competitions Committee (FCC) makes it recommendations sometime in the next few months.

On Tuesday, ahead of Thursday‚Äôs start of the last San Diego tournament that will be sponsored by Farmers Insurance, Schauffele admitted that he‚Äôs hardly the guy tying himself to a Torrey pine tree to save the event. But he also doesn‚Äôt seem overly concerned that the tournament is in danger of going away.

‚ÄúI think I would feel like Torrey's safe if you kind of look at the schedule, just from it should find a home because this property's iconic,‚Äù said the 10-time tour winner. ‚ÄúIt's a beautiful property, it's a big property, it's a tough golf course, and it usually has pretty good winners on it.‚Äù

Schauffele then pointed out the impact that Tiger Woods has had on Torrey Pines, and vice versa. Woods, who happens to lead the FCC, won here eight times, including the epic 2008 U.S. Open, and in turn, people flock to the site from all over the world and television viewers can likely recall memorable holes and shots at Torrey as much as most venues on tour.

‚ÄúI think Tiger single-handedly has made this property incredibly special in terms of a history in golf, just tying back to the '08 U.S. Open,‚Äù said Schauffele, who on-site as a youngster and scrambling to see Woods‚Äô incredible Sunday putt at 18 in ‚Äô08. ‚ÄúYou look at pretty golf courses that we have on tour, I'd say Torrey's one of them. I wouldn't be shocked if it was somewhere on the schedule.

‚ÄúI couldn't answer when or who would want to be a sponsor or something of that nature, but I think it's a strong enough course and a big enough course, a championship course to be on the schedule still.‚Äù

With talk that the Hawaiian Swing‚Äôs season-opening tournaments on Maui and Oahu might go away permanently after this season, and with the San Diego event looking for a new sponsor, speculation turns to the remaining events on the West Coast Swing. Pebble Beach and Riviera already host signature events, leaving The American Express and San Diego as those tournaments 

The Sentry, also a signature tournament and previously at Kapalua, seemingly would need a home, and The American Express is a three-course pro-am that wouldn‚Äôt appear conducive to hosting a limited field. That would seemingly leave Torrey Pines as a strong possible landing spot for The Sentry on the South Course. Tour officials are declining comment until the FCC delivers its report.

For Schauffele, with no Sentry at which to start the season, he skipped the first two events and begins at Torrey Pines, where, curiously, he has only two top-10 finishes in nine starts. He missed last year with a rib cage injury that ended up creating a sluggish start and middling play that led to him missing the Tour Championship for the first time.

Schauffele called it a ‚Äúbad year,‚Äù but it ended on a couple of very high notes. He and his wife, Maya, had their first child, a boy they named Victor, in late August, and in October, Schauffele shot 64 in the final round to win the Baycurrent Championship in Japan‚Äîthe country in which his mother was raised.

Of what it meant to get that season-ending win, Schauffele said, ‚ÄúWe had a kid, and, obviously, I'm going to take advantage and spend as much time with him and my wife. It was a big goal of mine to play well. So, I just know myself‚Äîif I didn't play well in Japan, I would have been super pumped to be there and be present [with him family], obviously, but at the same time something would have been just scratching at the back of my head of just like, ‚Äòyou suck,‚Äô you know what I mean? You've got to play a lot better.‚Äù

title: Dan Ige: Melquizael Costa was 'definitely a guy on the radar'
description: Dan Ige is not surprised to draw Melquizael Costa next.
fullText:
LAS VEGAS ‚Äì Dan Ige is not surprised to draw Melquizael Costa next.

Ige (19-10 MMA, 11-9 UFC) takes on the rising featherweight Costa (25-7 MMA, 6-2 UFC) at UFC Fight Night 267 on Feb. 21 at Toyota Center in Houston.

Costa, MMA Junkie's 2025 Under-the-Radar Fighter of the Year, had a banner year when scored four wins capped off with a head kick knockout of Morgan Charriere at at UFC on ESPN 73 in December.

"I had my eyes on him for a while," Ige told MMA Junkie of Costa. "I think he's called me out a couple of times ‚Äì and timing. Fights are all timing and who's available. He was definitely a guy on the radar and when they called me for the fight. It was like six weeks' notice. I've been training, I've been ready so, I was super pumped on the opportunity. I don't really care about rankings or anything right now. I'm just trying to get back in the win column, and go from there."

Ige has never been finished in his professional MMA career. Although he's lost three of his past four fights, he remains ranked in the UFC's featherweight division. However, Ige isn't focused on any of that. He can relate to Costa's rise, and won't allow him to make a name off him.

"He'll try, and I'll try and finish him," Ige said. "It'll definitely be a great fight for the fans, but I think I got my number on him and he's been looking great. I think four (or) five-fight winning streak and coming off a head kick knockout. He's been very active (with) I think four fights last year, and I know what that's like to have to take fight after fight after fight, and I've been there. Six-fight win streak and just fight after fight, and they throw you to the wolves. I'm the wolf and I'm ready to eat."

This article originally appeared on MMA Junkie: UFC Houston: Dan Ige had his eye on Melquizael Costa for a while

title: Broncos have fired offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi
description: The Denver Broncos announced that they have fired offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi, wide receivers coach Keary Colbert, and cornerbacks coach Addison Lynch. Sean Payton and the Broncos released a statement thanking all three coaches for their contributions to the team and wished them all the best in the future. ‚ÄúI want to thank these coaches [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Denver Broncos announced that they have fired offensive coordinator Joe Lombardi, wide receivers coach Keary Colbert, and cornerbacks coach Addison Lynch.

We‚Äôve parted ways with three assistant coaches.

‚Äî Denver Broncos (@Broncos) January 28, 2026

Sean Payton and the Broncos released a statement thanking all three coaches for their contributions to the team and wished them all the best in the future.

‚ÄúI want to thank these coaches for playing an important role in elevating our program over the last three seasons,‚Äù Payton said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been fortunate to work with Joe Lombardi for 15 years and am particularly grateful for his many contributions to our success as offensive coordinator.

‚ÄúWe sincerely appreciate Joe, Keary and Addison‚Äôs hard work and wish them all the best in the future.‚Äù

This comes as a bit of a surprise, as Lombardi has been one of Sean Payton‚Äôs most trusted coaches in recent seasons. Could this mean that the Broncos are making a play to keep offensive pass game coordinator/quarterbacks coach Davis Webb? He is a favorite for the Las Vegas Raiders head coaching job, so it‚Äôll be interesting to see how that plays out.

Lombardi served as the Broncos‚Äô offensive coordinator since the team hired Sean Payton back in 2023 and had previous experience with Payton during his time with the Saints. However, the Broncos‚Äô struggles on offense, which Payton talked about today, may have contributed to this firing.

Earlier today, during the end of the year press conference, Payton was asked about the struggling run game and told reporters that improving in that area is ‚Äúone of the key things we have to do this offseason‚Äù.

‚ÄúGreat question. I stepped into [Offensive Run Game Coordinator/Assistant Head Coach] Zach [Strief]‚Äôs office yesterday. I said look‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs probably a series of answers to that. That what we‚Äôre doing‚Ä¶ I feel like we‚Äôre far enough along with the RPOs and some of that but when we want to run it under center and control a game, we‚Äôve been able to do it a few times, but not as much as I‚Äôd like. That‚Äôll be an important study and with urgency, and then also with the runners, who are we asking‚Ä¶ Losing [RB] J.K. [Dobbins], obviously, that was a tough loss. He brought a lot to the locker, more than you would know. But that‚Äôll be one of the points of emphasis that I think that we research and look into heavily. I want to play from the gun, but I also will always want to play with a two-back or multiple tight end mindset [and] have that flexibility. It‚Äôs a good question. I think it‚Äôs one of the key things that we have to do this offseason.‚Äù

Then he was asked about the drops that plagued the Broncos‚Äô offense late this season and throughout the playoffs. He talked about how he likes his wide receiver room and how it has everything he wants at the position, but that there is a proper way to catch a football. He added they have to be better at teaching that this offseason.

‚ÄúLook, we drafted to it, and I like who we‚Äôve drafted to it. Yes, there were too many [drops] even down the stretch. The thing with the draft, man, we‚Äôve invested, and I like the players in that room. We‚Äôve got different‚Ä¶ We have speed, we have size, we have all the things I‚Äôm used to [and] you‚Äôd want to have in a good offense. But I think that there‚Äôs a proper way to catch a football, and most of the time, it‚Äôs with your thumbs together, not the other way around. The other way around, I‚Äôm serious, only exists when the ball is below your belly button. Even the deep balls should be caught with your thumbs together. So we have to be better at that.‚Äù

Now, did I anticipate that this would lead to Lombardi‚Äôs firing? I did not, but it is interesting to see what changes Payton makes to his coaching staff.

Pass game coordinator/quarterbacks coach Davis Webb would be the logical in-house replacement, but he is in the running to be the head coach of the Las Vegas Raiders. Regardless, the Broncos will have to interview at least two minority candidates to fulfill the Rooney Rule, so we will have to see which direction Payton and the team decides to go.

title: Seahawks projected $42 million dynamic playmaker predicted to leave Seattle for Broncos
description: A dynamic playmaker on the Seattle Seahawks is predicted to leave Mike Macdonald's squad this offseason and sign with the Denver Broncos in free agency.
fullText:
Seahawks projected $42 million dynamic playmaker predicted to leave Seattle for Broncos originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Seattle Seahawks traded for wide receiver Rashid Shaheed during the 2025 trade deadline, but the team will already have to make a decision on his future in the offseason.

Shaheed is set to enter free agency in the spring, and though Seattle could look to retain him, YardBarker's Seth Trachtman predicts the dynamic receiver will pack his bags and head to the Mile High to sign with the Denver Broncos.

Here is what¬†Trachtman said about Shaheed and his potential fit in Denver:

"Shaheed and Sean Payton didn't overlap in New Orleans, with Payton departing following the 2021 season and Shaheed signing out of the draft in 2022. Still, he's likely very familiar with the explosive wideout and kick returner, and Shaheed's skillset would be a perfect fit for a Broncos squad that needs more explosive weapons."

Shaheed hasn't had a very productive 2025 campaign, tallying 499 yards and two touchdowns in the regular season, including just 188 yards with Seattle.

However, the 27-year-old has shown that he can be an explosive playmaker. Shaheed also provides production in the return game, two Pro Bowls, and a first-team All-Pro selection in 2023 for his work on special teams.

In the right offense, Shaheed could blossom into a star playmaker. The Broncos need to supply quarterback Bo Nix with more weapons, and Shaheed would immediately step in as a primary deep threat in Denver's offense.

The Broncos are slated to have $27 million in cap space this offseason. Spotrac projects Shaheed will land a deal worth $42.3 million over three seasons, which averages to $14.1 million annually.

Though Shaheed may not be worth the price for some, the Broncos need receiving talent, and Shaheed still has promise with his game-breaking speed and big-play ability. General manager George Paton should look into signing the speedy receiver.

title: Dodgers 2026 Love L.A. Community Tour: Grocery Distribution and Playworks Recess Takeover
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers continued their 2026 Love L.A. Community Tour on Tuesday with two events throughout the city.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Dodgers continued their 2026 Love L.A. Community Tour on Tuesday with two events throughout the city.

The organization began the second day of its annual community service week with a grocery distribution at Christy‚Äôs Foundation in Northridge with Dodger alumni Billy Ashley, Ken Landreaux, and Dennis Powell.

The group passed out groceries and essentials to local families. Ashley, who spent six seasons with the Dodgers from 1992-1997, expressed gratitude for the organization‚Äôs tour.

‚ÄúIt means everything, the Dodgers have always been a big proponent of being able to give back to the community and a lot of the work that we do in the alumni is within the community‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs awesome,‚Äù Ashley said.

Tuesday afternoon, Dodger alumni Matt Luke and Powell visited Hollydale Elementary School in South Gate for the ‚ÄúPlayworks Recess Takeover.‚Äù The initiative centers on eighth-grade students in which ‚Äúmovement-based programming encourages interaction and helps break down social barriers.‚Äù

The Dodgers kicked off the the tour with their annual Employee Day of Service in North Hollywood at the Veteran Enriched Neighborhood.

The Dodgers are in the midst of their annual community service week, which runs from Monday, Jan. 26 to Friday, Jan. 30. The 2026 Dodgers Love L.A. Community Tour features 11 different stops as the team‚Äôs relationship with fans and the community is highlighted.

‚ÄúWe are honored to continue our partnership with Bank of America for our annual Dodgers Love L.A. Community Tour,‚Äù said Kristin McCowan, Vice President, Government and Community Affairs for the Los Angeles Dodgers.

‚ÄúFollowing another unforgettable season, we‚Äôre excited to extend the celebration beyond the ballpark and into the heart of our communities. This week is about meaningful service by supporting veterans and families, creating inclusive spaces for young people with special needs, celebrating our students and seniors, and recognizing the unwavering dedication of first responders. Together, we‚Äôre proud to uplift and empower the people and organizations that make Los Angeles thrive.‚Äù

The annual community service week essentially sets things in motion for the organization each year as the Dodgers Love L.A. Community Tour leads into DodgerFest with spring training to follow.

LOS ANGELES¬†‚Äî The back-to-back World Series champion Los Angeles Dodgers will stage their annual community service week ‚Äì¬†Dodgers Love L.A. Community¬†Tour presented by Bank of America¬†‚Äì beginning this Monday, January 26 through Friday, January 30.

The 2026 tour will feature 11 different stops over five days, highlighting the team‚Äôs special relationship with its fans and community neighbors in the city.

‚ÄúWe are honored to continue our partnership with Bank of America for our annual Dodgers Love L.A. Community Tour,‚Äù said Kristin McCowan, Vice President, Government and Community Affairs for the Los Angeles Dodgers. ‚ÄúFollowing another unforgettable season, we‚Äôre excited to extend the celebration beyond the ballpark and into the heart of our communities. This week is about meaningful service by supporting veterans and families, creating inclusive spaces for young people with special needs, celebrating our students and seniors, and recognizing the unwavering dedication of first responders. Together, we‚Äôre proud to uplift and empower the people and organizations that make Los Angeles thrive.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe week-long Dodgers Love L.A. Community Tour presented by Bank of America is always one of our favorite volunteer events ‚Äì bringing our World Champion Dodger players, alumni and staff together with BofA teammates to give back to those in need,‚Äù said Raul A. Anaya, Bank of America president, Los Angeles.?‚ÄúFrom building homes and distributing groceries to families to recognizing first responders, we aim to make a lasting impact throughout the week for as many of our neighbors as possible.‚Äù

The tour will begin on Monday with the Dodgers‚Äô annual Employee Day of Service in North Hollywood at the Veteran Enriched Neighborhood, which was established in 2023 in partnership with Homes 4 Families to provide affordable housing and support services for veterans and their families. Dodger front office staffers, Dodger sideline reporter Kirsten Watson and Bank of America employee volunteers will be tasked with building hands-on improvement projects to create shared spaces that promote connection and healing. Late in the afternoon at Adrian‚Äôs Place in Santa Monica, the Dodgers and select Dodger alumni will host a hands-on art workshop that encourages self-expression while taking pictures in a photo booth with the World Series trophy. Adrian‚Äôs Place is an inclusive community hub, dedicated to creating a welcoming space where families, friends, caregivers and professionals can connect, share experiences and access vital programs and services.

On Tuesday morning, Dodger alumni Billy Ashley, Ken Landreaux and Dennis Powell will pay a visit to Christy‚Äôs Foundation in Northridge, where the group will pass out groceries and essentials. Christy‚Äôs Foundation helps to empower families and individuals to overcome food insecurity by ensuring access to fresh, nutritious and culturally relevant food. In the afternoon, Dodger alumni Matt Luke and Powell will stop by¬†Hollydale Elementary School in South Gate, where the duo will participate in a ‚ÄúPlayworks Recess Takeover,‚Äù with eighth-grade students in which movement-based programming encourages interaction and helps break down social barriers.

On Wednesday¬†morning in San Bernardino, 1981 World Series MVP Steve Yeager will join a special appreciation lunch in San Bernardino that recognizes the 10-year anniversary of those who were affected by the tragic shooting at a Christmas party for county employees that saw 14 people lose their lives and 22 others seriously wounded. On the Dodgers Love L.A. tour in January 2016, Dodger legend Andre Ethier and Hall of Famer Tommy Lasorda had an impactful lunch with victims and first responders from the 2015 terrorist attack. Later on Wednesday, Ashley will take the World Series trophy over to the City of Los Angeles Emergency Management Department (EMD) in recognition of its continued dedication and service to our communities. Employees will have the opportunity to take photos with the trophy, meet and interact with Ashley, and enjoy a moment of appreciation and celebration during their workday.

On Thursday, two-time Cy Young award winner Blake Snell and Landon Knack will join both Dodger and Bank of America staffers at the Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach. Students from the 75th¬†St. Elementary school will take part in an educational field trip and have lunch with the Dodger left-hander. Thursday concludes with a special ‚ÄúSenior Prom‚Äù for local senior citizens at the nearby Glendale Recreation Center. Dodger players Jack Dreyer, Will Klein, Dalton Rushing and River Ryan will be on hand for the festivities.

The Dodgers Love L.A. Community Tour wraps up on Friday with a very special pep rally at El Rancho High School in Pico Rivera. Current Dodger players Alex Call, Jack Dreyer, Brusdar Graterol, Landon Knack, Bobby Miller, Miguel Rojas, Tanner Scott, Brock Stewart and Gavin Stone will¬†participate¬†in interactive rally games and student engagement activities. Following the pep rally, the same Dodgers will then visit Frank Hotchkin Memorial Training Center right next to Dodger Stadium. The Boys in Blue will bring along the World Series trophy and salute local firefighters in recognition of the one-year anniversary of the devastating fires in Altadena and the Palisades last year.

Finally, Graterol and Snell will finish out the tour by surprising and delighting customers at a local Jack in the Box. Stay tuned to the Dodgers social media channels to found out the exact location on January 30.

title: Rose Namajunas heads to eye surgery after UFC 324 loss
description: ‚ÄúThug Rose‚Äù is going under the knife. Former two-time Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) Strawweight champion Rose Namajunas saw her title hopes at a second weight class come to a screeching halt this past weekend (Sat., Jan. 24, 2026), dropping a close unanimous decision to No. 1 Flyweight contender Natalia Silva at UFC 324 inside T-Mobile [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
‚ÄúThug Rose‚Äù is going under the knife.

Former two-time Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) Strawweight champion Rose Namajunas saw her title hopes at a second weight class come to a screeching halt this past weekend (Sat., Jan. 24, 2026), dropping a close unanimous decision to No. 1 Flyweight contender Natalia Silva at UFC 324 inside T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada.

As if the loss itself wasn‚Äôt brutal enough, Namajunas revealed she‚Äôs now facing a lengthy recovery after suffering a serious eye injury during the fight. Earlier today, the 33-year-old shared on Instagram that she was scheduled to undergo canalicular tube surgery ‚Äî a procedure to repair a torn tear-duct system caused by repeated eye pokes.

‚ÄúAlright, guys, I‚Äôm headed into surgery,‚Äù Namajunas said on Instagram today. ‚ÄúCanalicular tube surgery. I got poked in the eye a few times in the fight, so yeah. But my tube is torn so it‚Äôs going to be repaired right now. I‚Äôm going to have a silicone tube in my eye. Three months, so pray for me, guys. Just glad we can get it fixed.‚Äù

Canalicular tube surgery is no small matter. The procedure repairs a torn tear drainage canal in the inner corner of the eyelid ‚Äî an injury that can cause constant watering, irritation, and vision issues if left untreated. An oculoplastic surgeon reconnects the damaged tissue and inserts a small silicone stent to keep the duct open while it heals. The stent typically remains in place for three to six months before being removed in-office.

The stent stays in for 3‚Äì6 months before easy removal in the office. When done soon after injury, it usually restores normal tear drainage successfully, though fighters face temporary discomfort and limited training during recovery.

According to Ariel Helwani, Namajunas also won‚Äôt be able to sneeze or blow her nose for the next three months ‚Äî an uncomfortable but necessary precaution during recovery. Yikes.

The timing couldn‚Äôt be worse for Namajunas, who reportedly had a guaranteed title shot against Flyweight champion Valentina Shevchenko lined up with a win over Silva. Instead, she‚Äôll be sidelined and forced to rebuild yet again in a crowded division.

Namajunas is now 1‚Äì2 in her last three fights and sits at 3‚Äì3 since moving up to Flyweight. While her championship dreams aren‚Äôt officially dead, the road back just got significantly longer ‚Äî and more painful.

For more UFC 324: ‚ÄúGaethje vs. Pimblett‚Äù news and notes be sure to hit up our comprehensive event archive right here.
